titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Riki Kobayashi Academic Papers, 1949-1997 UA 323
titlestmt.author: Norie Guthrie

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-02 13:16:30 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Riki Kobayashi Academic Papers
did.abstract: This collections consists of the academic papers of Riki Kobayashi, including his correspondence, publications, and course materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Riki Kobayashi was the Louis Calder Chair in Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering. He received his BA in Engineering from Rice in 1944 and an MSE and PhD from the University of Michigan in 1947 and 1951, respectively. His research focused on vapor-liquid phase equilibria, PVT measurement interpretations, hydrate measurement interpretations, chromatographic measurements, transport property measurements, and light scattering in the fluid critical region. His lifelong work benefitted the natural gas industry, and he has close ties to the Gas Processors Association. He also is a member of The Academy of Medicine, Engineering and Science of Texas and the National Academy of Engineering.
Some information taken from--"A Technical Biography of Professor Kobayahi's Work" written by E. Dendy Sloan and Pervaiz Nasir" in the 1980s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of five series, including academic materials, correspondence, course materials, publications, and student work. Of the five, Kobayashi's publications make up the largest part of the collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This materials is open for research. Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Additional materials are not expected for this collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials collected and donated by Melissa Kean in 2012.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Riki Kobayashi Academic Papers, 1941-1997, UA 323, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this material must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: These materials appear to be the student work of Riki Kobayashi. The exact date of the materials is unknown.
